MASS.

15, Cacmapen

/16. ar Luki

August 1, 1909. 
Mr A.E. Stearna; 
Andorr Academy :

Dear sin, 
I thank you for your

to the note 
prompt and considerate reply

o wrate in reference to duck. I had a 
letter from the worthy gentleman some 
days ago which was an epitome of

me that it was cool and refreshing 
ar tahlwm ham, that he was with a 
congenial friends that her intended to

finally that he opened that we should 
not have the pleasure of his company 
at

and 
our camp. The utterly cool 
self assured tone of his epistle would

et not occurred 
have delighted me. had

Cur camp, as you perhaps know?

I had a  letter from the worthy gentleman some  days ago which was an epitome of  exquisite chinese humour, te informed  me that it was cool and refreshing  ar tahlwm ham, that he was with a  congenial friends that her intended to  depart for Hamilton dry shortly and  finally that he opened that we should  not have the pleasure of his company  at  and  our camp. The utterly cool  self assured tone of his epistle would  et not occurred  have delighted me. had  to me that our plans were thereby put  out of yout.  Cur camp, as you perhaps know?  n  and was not Established  a small one  pruniarily for personal profet. We under  to gue  took its establishment mi order

metadata.name: Phillips Academy
metadata.abstract: Letter stating that he had a letter from Luk some days ago which was humorous in explaining that he would not attend summer camp, citing the pleasant time he was having in Ashburnham. Further, he was about to go to Hamilton, NY with friends. Cunningham states that this letter would have delighted him, if not for the fact that Luk would not attend camp. He explains that the camp was not established for personal profit. Rather, it is intended to provide a summer study opportunity and the fact that Luk was not attending had a bearing on their financial standing. He asks Stearns to make thi all clear to Luk, and to impress upon him the ideals of Anglo-Saxon honor; while Luk may not realize it, he has greatly inconvenienced them.
metadata.collection: Head of School (Stearns) correspondence with Chinese alumni
